title: Rugby World Cup 2019 live scores: France vs Wales updates
text:
Wales was cut down to 14-men when Ross Moriarty put a sickening high shot on France's Gael Fickou.

Running across as Fickou returned a kick, Moriarty thumped him across the chin with a swinging arm at speed.

Moriarty had only just come onto the field as a replacement.

He didn't even get two minutes on the field before his hit on Fickou was reviewed by the TMO – which advised the referee to give him 10 minutes in the bin.

France scored again through Virimi Vakatawa to extend their lead to 19-10 before Moriarty was cleared to return to the field just before half time.

The damage had already been done.

"I can only imagine how much (Wales coach Warren) Gatland will be seething that Moriarty's brief cameo ended with a yellow card," the BBC's Dafydd Pritchard reported.
